title: Getting started with modules
text: purpose vignette demonstrate NS() moduleServer() create isolated namespaces IDs module. , ’ll create basic module: reactvals packages ’ll use loaded :

title: Getting started with modules
text: fastest way add module using Posit’s code snippets, can access using Tools > Edit Code Snippets :  open Edit Snippets window can add edit existing code snippets. ’ll place new module snippet end/bottom:  code create module snippet : Note ’m using mod_ prefix functions, _ui _server suffix entering snippet code, click Save. create new module, create .R file using drop-usethis::use_r(), start typing module:  module naming convention preference, ’s good practice make sure can easily identify UI server module function pairs (able use tab-completion always nice, ) can hit tab BAM–new code module: cursor set <name> UI server module functions, can just type new name new module:  changes places:  also covered Mastering Shiny.
code: snippet module     mod_${1:name}_ui <- function(id) {       ns <- shiny::NS(id)       shiny::tagList(         ${0}       )     }      mod_${1:name}_server <- function(id) {              shiny::moduleServer(id, function(input, output, session) {                     ns <- session$ns             })      } mod_name_ui <- function(id) {   ns <- shiny::NS(id)   shiny::tagList(      ) }  mod_name_server <- function(id) {      shiny::moduleServer(id, function(input, output, session) {         ns <- session     })    }

title: Getting started with modules
code: # put in UI ----   mod_reactvals_ui <- function(id) {   ns <- shiny::NS(id)   shiny::tagList(     shiny::fluidRow(       shiny::column(         width = 12,         shiny::verbatimTextOutput(           outputId = ns('vals')         )       )     )   ) }  # put in server ----       mod_reactvals_server <- function(id) {         shiny::moduleServer(id, function(input, output, session) {           ns <- session$ns           output$vals <- shiny::renderPrint({             vals <- shiny::reactiveValuesToList(               x = input, all.names = TRUE             )             print(vals)           })         })     }

title: Getting started with modules
text: app identical app Getting Started {shinytest2} Part | Example + basics | RStudio.
code: mod_reactvals_ui <- function(id) {   ns <- shiny::NS(id)   shiny::tagList(      ) }  mod_reactvals_server <- function(id) {      shiny::moduleServer(id, function(input, output, session) {         ns <- session     })    } library(shiny) library(stringr)  ui <- shiny::fluidPage(   shiny::textInput("name", "what is your name"),   shiny::actionButton("greet", "Greet"),   shiny::textOutput("greeting"),   shiny::textOutput("first_letter") )  server <- function(input, output, session) {    output$greeting <- shiny::renderText({     shiny::req(input$name)     paste0("Hello ", input$name, "!")   }) |>     bindEvent({input$greet})    first_letter <- shiny::reactive({     shiny::req(input$name)     stringr::str_to_lower(       stringr::str_extract(input$name, "^."))   }) |>     shiny::bindEvent({input$greet})    output$first_letter <- shiny::renderText({     paste0("The first letter in your is ",           first_letter(), "!")   })  }  shiny::shinyApp(ui, server)

title: Authors and Citation
Authors and Citation
text: Frigaard M (2023). shinymods: collection shiny tools & modules. R package version 0.1.1.2, https://mjfrigaard.github.io/shinymods/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {shinymods: A collection of shiny tools & modules},   author = {Martin Frigaard},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.1.2},   url = {https://mjfrigaard.github.io/shinymods/}, }

what: A collection of shiny tools & modules
title: A collection of shiny tools & modules
text: shinymods contains collection modules (helper functions) designed make creating, using, testing modules easier. ’ve intentionally kept modules minimal, without complex layout functions additional dependencies, behaviors predictable.

title: A collection of shiny tools & modules
text: can install development version shinymods like :

title: A collection of shiny tools & modules
text: mod = TRUE, prnt_reactvals() returns module UI server code mod = FALSE , prnt_reactvals() returns UI server code shiny::tagList() (without shiny::NS() shiny::moduleServer()) view modules work, run reactValsDemo()  get_flat_data(name, id, mod = TRUE, return_data = TRUE): imports external data files shiny application. get_xlsx_data(name, id, mod = TRUE): imports external excel files shiny application disp_reactable_table(name, id, mod = TRUE): displays data reactable table disp_dt_table(name, id, mod = TRUE): displays data DT table.
code: prnt_reactvals(name = "vals", id = "dev", mod = TRUE)   # put in UI ---- mod_vals_ui <- function(id) {   ns <- shiny::NS(id)   shiny::tagList(   # << include additional input IDs >>     shiny::icon('user-astronaut'),       shiny::verbatimTextOutput(         outputId = ns('dev')     ) ) }   # put in server ---- mod_vals_server <- function(id) {    shiny::moduleServer(id, function(input, output, session) {       ns <- session$ns        output$dev <- shiny::renderPrint({         vals <- shiny::reactiveValuesToList(           x = input, all.names = TRUE         )         print(vals)     })   }) } prnt_reactvals(name = "vals", id = "dev", mod = FALSE) # put in UI ----   shiny::tagList(     shiny::tags$code('vals'),       shiny::icon('user-astronaut'),         shiny::verbatimTextOutput(           outputId = 'dev'         )   )  # put in server ----   output$dev <- shiny::renderPrint({     vals <- shiny::reactiveValuesToList(       x = input, all.names = TRUE     )     print(vals)   })

text: UI server contains examples following get_flat_data() function arguments:
code: get_flat_data(name = 'import', id = 'data', mod = TRUE, return_data = TRUE) get_flat_data(name = 'import', id = 'data', mod = FALSE, return_data = FALSE)

title: Example get imported data application — getDataDemo
text: mod return_data set TRUE, module display imported data. verify data imported, getDataDemo() additional module (mod_prnt_data_ui()/server()) renders imported data via shiny::verbatimTextOutput() shiny::renderPrint().

title: Example get imported data application — getDataDemo
text: mod set FALSE, get_flat_data() returns UI server code importing data returning reactive object (imported_data()). getDataDemo() also displays data using shiny::verbatimTextOutput() shiny::renderPrint()

Get flat data file module — get_flat_data

title: Get flat data file module — get_flat_data
text: name name module id namespace id mod logical, module? return_data logical, return flat file data reactive list?

title: Get flat data file module — get_flat_data
Get flat data file module — get_flat_data
code: # return data import (module) get_flat_data(name = "import", id = "data", mod = TRUE, return_data = TRUE) #> Error: RStudio not running # return data import (UI and server code) get_flat_data(name = "import", id = "data", mod = FALSE, return_data = TRUE) #> Error: RStudio not running # do not return data import (module) get_flat_data(name = "import", id = "data", mod = TRUE, return_data = FALSE) #> Error: RStudio not running # do not return data import (UI and server code) get_flat_data(name = "import", id = "data", mod = FALSE, return_data = FALSE) #> Error: RStudio not running
